text: I'm a huge fan of quesadillas but
they're not always the best for you so
this is a really really great way to
make them a little bit better for you
and get delicious dark leafy greens
these quesadillas with collard greens
and white beans don't take any time to
prepare you can also use any leftover
greens you happen to have on hand and
they're a really delicious satisfying
meal so let's start with the collard
greens I have a pan heating on medium
here I'm going to add to that two
tablespoons of olive oil
give it a nice swirl add one shallot
thinly sliced we'll cook these shallots
until they're just tender slightly
caramelized around the edges about six
minutes give it a good seasoning of salt
and a stir my shallots are caramelized
around the edges this started out as
about a pound and a half of collard
greens I remove the rib this is going to
help them cook really quickly so add
these and a half a cup of water
more salts
give it a good stir make sure everything
is nicely coated here and then cover it
and let it steam until the greens are
just tender but still bright green which
will be about 810 minutes let's check
the greens here it's been about 10
minutes so add the beans this is one and
a half cups cooked white beans you can
either use canned or homemade so the
beans are going to add a nice amount of
protein fiber flavor just overall
hardiness any time I'm using white beans
I love black pepper it's such a great
combination lots of pepper
alright this looks wonderful so set this
aside while we work on the tortilla so I
have two flour tortillas here about
eight inches and I always like to preach
oast them before they actually hit the
pan and this just helps make a really
nice crunchy quesadilla kind of the
secret to quesadilla making if you don't
have a gas range you can also use a
broiler you don't want them to get too
dry just crisped up slightly you can see
when they start to bubble like that
they're in good shape to assemble keep
the heat on medium I've had this cast
iron preheating I love cast iron for
quesadilla maker II because the heat is
distributed nice and evenly get a really
nice toast on both sides so heat your
pan to medium we'll add one of our
toasted guys I'm gonna use some cheddar
cheese here you could really use any
sort of cheese you like so we're
shooting for about half a cup of cheese
per tortilla well add our greens mixture
so this mixture yields enough for about
four portions so just kind of eyeball it
pick out about a quarter of it that's
all you need
top that onto your quesadilla and we'll
add the rest of our cheese delicious
delicious there we go
about a quarter cup more cheese here
popped with our other tortilla already
smelling great and we'll just kind of
press this cook this for about three
minutes per side just until everything's
nice and melted and holding together so
it's been about three minutes I can see
the cheese on the outside is nice and
melty
flip it over carefully Gor Jess just
press it down slightly just to make sure
it adheres so it's been about another
two to three minutes you can sort of
peek at the bottom and see what's going
on so transfer it to a cutting board cut
this into wedges like so looks great
transfer to a plate this looks so good
can't wait to try it
yum yum last touch finishing touch
little dash of freshness let's add
tomato salsa you could really use any
salsa here you wanted you could use
tomato anything that you'd like it's
just nice sort of fresh hit to have with
this really hearty delicious meal all
right let's try I think I might just cut
this one a little bit smaller ambitious
with the quarters there all right
mmm totally delicious and the perfect
